title: Exellent

review:
Instagram has made changes that have mistakenly deactivated thousands of users from accessing their accounts - including mine. They have deactivated for ‚Äúbreaching terms of conditions‚Äù without any warning sent to the users or reason. You just get a generic message and are left wondering what you did.  

Now, the issue is if you ever need help from Instagram, there is NO way to contact their help centre. It is the actual worst. All of their help just loop you to their FAQs but don‚Äôt actually provide any help in recovering accounts that were deactivated by Instagram unfairly and without reason. 

If you check their Twitter posts, read all the comments. Hundreds of users desperate to try to reach Instagram taking to Twitter, or spamming fb to try and get help. 

And the worst ? NOW REAL hackers and scammers are taking advantage of these desperate people and offering ‚Äúhacker accounts‚Äù to get their accounts back. Charging real money and then gaining access to banking info. Why are these con artists not deactivated for breaching policy??

There is a HUGE error going on, with zero communication from Instagram. No acknowledgement. No timeline on when these users can get their accounts back. 

So be warned. Delete all third party apps that log in to your account because that is what can trip up their automated system to just disable your account with no warning.  It thinks you are using bots automatically and will keep you in the dark for weeks to months. 

Instagram, I‚Äôve really lost my trust in this platform. Unacceptable lack of customer service and acknowledgement. I hope more people speak up about this.
title: The worst customer service. Have lost faith in trusting Instagram

review:
The new layout makes it obvious that the company only cares about making money and not the creators or consumers who liked Instagram for what it uniquely was. 

This new update takes away what was special about Instagram and replaced it with an embarrassing, desperate attempt to compete with e-commerce stores and other apps.

You don‚Äôt need to have what everyone else has when you are in your own lane.

It‚Äôs also very clear that you know people will click the shop button from muscle memory. Really huge slap in the face for all IG users.

This is my main app and now I‚Äôm working on figuring out what other avenues I can use instead. Really, really disappointed.
title: Ruined a great thing

The first being the inability to see how many likes a post has. Another they removed chronological ordering like Facebook (spoiler alert: most people stopped using it 6 years ago when that came out) and now I rarely see any friends posts. I follow 341 people, about 50 of them are either businesses or celebrities, yet I can go DAYS without seeing a post from someone I know. To add to this your feed goes like this: 3 posts from people you‚Äôre following, advertisement, 3 posts from following, advertisement. Which means if you dont see posts from people you know, chances are your feed will be a wall advertisements.

Since the beginning of instagram there was a mandatory crop to make the picture a square, since then they let you post a rectangle with white borders but its still not the full picture. I cant stand taking a picture, and then having no choice but to crop it. It makes me not want to upload.

review:
Used to love instagram. It was easily my main app and I checked it several times daily for the last seven years. My decision to delete the app occurred after several recent disturbing incidents.

 I recently saw an account with deeply Anti Semitic memes appear as sponsored content in my feed. The meme featured a star of david and a bacteria cell with a little girl pointing at the star of david. The caption read ‚Äúbecky point to the greater danger‚Äù. 

I reported the meme to instagram twice only to receive a report that the meme was not appraised to be racist. I was unable to take any other meaningful action and unable to receive any other explanation for how this content appeared in my feed.

Whats particularly disturbing to me is that instagram added this account to my feed without my permission. Previously I had seen ads appear in my feed. Fair enough. The idea that deeply prejudiced memes could appear in my feed as sponsored content is really distressing to me. 

Additionally, I recently encountered a ‚Äúyou‚Äôre all caught up‚Äù message. After which my feed is filled with accounts I do not follow. I am unable to see posts by friends or family. I used to enjoy this app as a way of connecting with loved ones. Now i‚Äôm just looking at strangers. At a time where its hard enough to see friends and family, this decision is selfish and disappointing on instagrams part.

This sucks. Really used to love the app and I‚Äôm sorry to move on. This is not the same app I opted into seven years ago. I would not recommend it to friends or family going forward. I feel after sometime they will ultimately see it as an unsettling experience. Hopefully changes can be made to make the app consumer friendly again and provide greater accountability for users with negative experiences.
title: Unsettling recent experiences and ZERO accountability

review:
There‚Äôs more ads than my friends posts. One of the main buttons is now a shopping page. 
Instagram is not what it used to be...
I rarely see my friends posts anymore and instead I see more influencers and ‚Äúsuggested pages‚Äù to follow. Funny enough, I‚Äôm following over 1000 friends or people I know but yet I see about 4 new posts a day from them and the rest are suggestions or ads. 

This app is no longer what was originally intended for and just another shopping and advertising app. I can‚Äôt wait for the next new Instagram like app to be developed that‚Äôs not as commercialised as this stupid app. I might as well go on Amazon, or watch the Kardashians or maybe watch tik toks... because that‚Äôs what Instagram has become. :)
title: Shopping App and a platform for influencers

review:
Understandably, IG has community guidelines. 

However, as a new small business that is new to navigating these guidelines- mistakes may have been made.

On the other hand, major fashion brands such as @fashionnova whom sell similar (if not the same) products as my store, promote their products without recourse. 

I have tried to dispute the ban on my promotional ad services and have not been able to get a response or a lift on my ban.

With a better understanding of the guidelines I WILL be more conscious of these guidelines. 

However, I find it incredibly unfair that major fashion brands such as @prettylittlething and @fashionnova can advertise their products without consequences, but small fashion brands such as myself are penalized from running ads (which greatly support the growth of my small business). 

Please reconsider your decision regarding my promotional abilities. 

Thank you,

Owner @kashkollective.
title: AD ISSUES

review:
Instagram has been in the game of censoring and deplatforming people whose work, art and content is‚Äîrather arbitrarily‚Äîdeemed sexual for quite a while. But recently the ‚Äúcrackdown‚Äù on sex workers, sex educators, queer people, fat people, flirty people... has reached a new level. Censorship in the name of ‚Äúending sex trafficking‚Äù has been shown, by study after study, to do nothing to reduce sex trafficking and abuse, and does everything to force these industries further underground and further away from regulation and moderation. Censorship is unsafe, especially for those who are most vulnerable to sexual abuse and victimization, and instagram‚Äôs puritanical campaign to remove so-called sexual content is an assault on freedom of expression and demonstrates a blatant disregard for the people that these anti-sex trafficking movements purport to be protecting. 
I am disgusted but not surprised by this progression on a platform that profits off of, but refuses to protect, sex workers and all other content creators who will be silenced even further by these regulations.

review:
The new update is infuriating. Instagram was supposed to be a photo sharing app and now button to post photos/videos has been moved to an awkward spot chat can only be reached if you‚Äôre on the home page. Notifications don‚Äôt update regularly and the option to refresh all the updates isn‚Äôt there anymore so you have to scroll up through all of them and swipe down to refresh. This update has made my hate using Instagram and it used to be my favourite app. It was a great way to stay connected with friends but now it‚Äôs almost pointless. I‚Äôd delete it if it wasn‚Äôt required for my business. 

It‚Äôs clear that Facebook and Instagram have been moving in the direction of focusing on features and ads where they can make more money but it‚Äôs unfortunate that the user experience has to suffer because of that. Many businesses use Facebook and Instagram to market and reach their customers but what happens when their customers have all moved on to using other apps? Users grow more and more frustrated with each major update that makes the platform less user friendly and that will push them to search for other apps to use as an alternative. 

I‚Äôd love to hope that Instagram would release an update that‚Äôs a happy medium of the new release and previous versions but that‚Äôs probably wishful thinking. So I hope a new app surfaces that people can transition to where we can actually share posts and stories without being stuck in a mess of ads and shopping posts.

title: Watch reels

review: The spirit of instagram is to share photos and connect with your friends and others. Every single ‚Äúupdate‚Äù adds a feature from other apps that is unnecessary and clouds up the user interface. The simplicity of the app hot bar has been ruined by adding ‚Äúshop‚Äù and ‚Äúreels‚Äù (reels is the same format as TikTok) instead of explore. The notifications and explore page can only be reached from your non-chronological feed‚Äôs homepage which is inconvenient to use. There is not even a tutorial that opens upon first use of the app post-update that tells you how to use each feature correctly, or where they are. Instagram has been incredibly and increasingly frustrating to use since the ‚ÄúStories‚Äù update, and it is harder to support small businesses, creators, and even my friends! I can‚Äôt see my friends‚Äô most recent posts anymore due to the algorithm never showing up recent posts in my feed. I am unhappy with Instagram‚Äôs userface and lack of integrity toward creating a social media platform that at it‚Äôs heart is to share photos and/or videos via posts with your friends. I will be deleting my account service due to all of the bullcrap a small user like myself has had to put up with. If you are considering making an account service, don‚Äôt bother. The team doesn‚Äôt prioritize anything in particular except for stealing social media ideas from other platforms. It all went downhill after the chronological feed feature was removed PERMANENTLY.
title: Don‚Äôt bother making an account service, the Instagram Facebook team doesn‚Äôt care about you.

review: I am a person with mental and physical disabilities. Despite all that I had an amazing and supportive following of over 8000. And then the harassment started. The impersonations, the threats, the hacking... I had this account for maybe three years and I went from wanting to die and give up on all my hopes to feeling like maybe even I am capable of anything, even healing somehow with all this support... to being disabled. My account is now disabled. Just. Like. Me. They said my account had strange activity and that I was breaking the rules. The fact I was hacked and brutally harassed so much in the passed four months (or more) means nothing to them. No one was ever blocked. Fake accounts with my personal name and images of me stayed UP. I plead my case and they have kept it disabled from me. I showed them IDs with personal info, I showed them pictures of me. Nothing. Back to no support. The bullies have won and hurts my heart so bad. Instagram isn‚Äôt safe, I guess. I really hope that they put things back, but... it doesn‚Äôt look good. I feel so damn alone. I guess no matter what you do, no matter what you try. It always gets taken away.
title: Instagram doesn‚Äôt care about bullied disabled people

review:
Instagram has a horrible habit of completely ignoring the client base and having no idea what they seem to want. 
First, it was the algorithm. Screwing with when and how people interacted with their peers and friends was frustrating enough. However, now they have added in yet another useless feature in the form of Suggested Posts - that really just prevents you from seeing all of your friends posts. Suggested posts should, if present at all, be hosted on the Explore page. Currently, there is truly no benefit to how much random content and ads are now being shoved in our faces.
Scrolling through Twitter responses and reviews here, it is clear that this is the general opinion of most people. Why does Instagram insist on adding features that do nothing more than clog our feeds????

It seriously blows my mind how much worse Instagram has generally gotten for users over the past 4 years. 

Now in yet another awful idea, my home feed starts showing me random suggested posts after I‚Äôve seen all ‚Äúnew‚Äù posts from the people I follow, instead of scrolling through old posts I may have already seen (that I may want to see again). 

It doesn‚Äôt help that if you scroll over a post once, it counts as read. I often will scroll while talking to roommates/friends or watching sports, and I usually miss a few posts because I‚Äôm not paying attention. Well now they‚Äôve made it way easier to miss your friends posts, just so they can promote more content. What even is the point of this app if your friends posts are hidden behind layers of random content??

I am so tired of Instagram constantly choosing to shove as much content down my throat as possible, I wish I could uninstall the last 15 updates if I‚Äôm being honest.

review:
I don‚Äôt usually write a review, but I‚Äôve decided to write one for Instagram

Pros 
- easy to find everything 

- easy to post, like and comment 

- fun and a good time killer 

Cons
- there‚Äôs some things you can‚Äôt comment and that‚Äôs annoying, especially when you‚Äôre trying to joke with friends

- you should be able to post whatever you‚Äôd like, but you should add a tag to it, like NSFW, DARK HUMOUR, POLITICAL, ETC to keep EVERYONE on your app happy

Bugs

- I get a bug where I‚Äôm no longer able to type and I have to reset the app, I have no idea what causes this but it has gotten a bit annoying 

- There‚Äôs another bug that happens where it says people are online when they‚Äôre clearly not, this bug happens a lot and I have to reset my Instagram for it to show the real activity status 

Overall this app isn‚Äôt bad, but it‚Äôs not great, 3 stars, if they address my cons and the bugs I have no issue bumping it up to a 4 or 5
title: Meh

review: I just created a new account after completely deleting my old one. Obviously I‚Äôm going to start following a bunch of people, and liking a lot of things. I took a break from Instagram for over a month, so recreating an account takes time and it means following a lot of people in a short period of time in order to set your account up. I have been blocked from liking, commenting, following, and posting with a message that says ‚ÄúBased on previous use of this feature your account has been temporarily blocked from taking this action. We restrict certain content and actions to protect our community. Tell us if we‚Äôve made a mistake‚Äù. I am doing nothing wrong, and my account is being blocked. I‚Äôve ‚Äútold them‚Äù by clicking ‚Äútell us‚Äù every time this pop up came up, I‚Äôve written in to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù at least 4 times explaining the situation, but my account was still blocked. Once it is unlocked, am I going to get penalized for following or liking things? Why is there a limit? Why can‚Äôt I just use my account for what it‚Äôs meant for? If you‚Äôre going to block me because you think I‚Äôm a bot, and then tell me that I should ‚Äútell you‚Äù if you‚Äôre wrong but NEVER ANSWER OR HELP ME, what‚Äôs the point of having this account? I‚Äôm extremely frustrated and I need something to be done. Instagram clearly needs a better system to battle their ‚Äúbots‚Äù, because innocent users are getting penalized for absolutely nothing. Figure it out.
title: Ridiculous

review:
I‚Äôve used Instagram for about 6 years now and it‚Äôs been a pretty good product. It‚Äôs clean, the updates are nice and the features are cool. However, I‚Äôve encountered a bug that is fundamentally debilitating to the Instagram experience:

Over the past 2 weeks, the Direct Messaging features on BOTH of my accounts have been bugging out and not showing up. I‚Äôve tried uninstalling the app, logging out, restarting my phone, and clearing up storage space on my phone itself. Out of all of those attempts, the issue has still not been fixed.

I‚Äôve sent reports to the Instagram support team and I‚Äôve looked on forums online to see if others have experienced this problem. As it turns out, hundreds of people have been through this too.

Direct messaging is an integral part of Instagram itself and it allows the users to better connect with their followers and friends. It‚Äôs disappointing to have it be taken away so randomly through a bug.
title: Good app, but Direct Messaging problems are inherent

review: Their spam detectors are far too reactive, many times falsely disabling features for no reason. This would be understandable considering errors are bound to occur, but there is no way to contact Instagram with a guaranteed response to resolve these issues. This is dangerous for businesses, including the ones who spend ads to keep their own service running. Instagram doesn‚Äôt care as long as they keep making revenue. They removed likes in order to make people more ‚Äúfocused on content rather than people‚Äôs engagement.‚Äù Let‚Äôs be honest. That‚Äôs useless because it takes from the dopamine rush that made Instagram what it is. People will continue to find things to judge, including the number of comments. As Instagram progressively updates their algorithm, further limiting recognition opportunity for smaller accounts, they will begin to experiment more openly with social media. Instagram is becoming a cage, milking dollars out of people, and lowering the engagement for the ones who refuse to spend money. We all need to find a better alternative, especially if in 2020, you want to grow as an influencer, artist, business, etc.
title: End life for FaceBook.

review:
The platform is, in general, ok. 
It does, however, come with a major flaw; FAKE ACCOUNT ATTACKS.
Every day - that‚Äôs, again, every day, we have roughly 6 to 10 new fake accounts following us.
Out of this count, one or two a day will start messaging us directly with always the same approach. The pictures are constantly used to create these accounts who automatically follow our page. This is unacceptable and there is nothing that can be done to permanently block the IPS or report them. 

Instagram participates to the propagation of these accounts by not allowing the users to defend themselves.

This situation is exasperating and we don‚Äôt see any way out!
2000+ fake accounts blocked so far and they keep coming!!!!

Update: still no ways to block regions like FB. 5k+ account blocked !
title: FAKE ACCOUNT BEWARE

review: This app is absolute trash, the post story function isn't able to put multiple images onto one post (in stories, not posts). The constant reworking of the UI has been bothering me a lot and I'd rather have a consistent app that is easy to use yet has the basic functionality that it should have. Posting images and videos also adds the "Instagram version" into my camera roll, which I do not want. It also doesn't work well with my iPhone 11's aspect ratio and posting images will always have sides cropped out, either making them look ugly or incomplete. It also demands camera and microphone access, which I have consistently denied so far. When enabled, you can't set the camera and microphone access to be disabled by default when entering a video chat, so they basically took away my access to some important privacy options. Instagram is also hella broken on Windows 10. The website is like half-working and the app on the Microsoft Store has the same issues. And the app on the Microsoft Store doesn't let you join video chats which is very inconvenient for people like me who spend most of the time working on a PC without a phone nearby.
title: Demands Camera and Microphone Access

review:
Thank you to IG for curing my years-long addiction to this app themselves.

I appreciated losing the numbers under posts, but moving notifications to a hidden button next to DMs, and replacing it with a marketplace? Oh my god I have never hated a move by a company this much since Big Oil's anti-climate propaganda in the 70s. And I wasn't here for that.

The entire app's design is no longer about the creator. It HIDES budding creators, burying them underneath people who are trying to sell me things, and now the marketplace function (something I NEVER asked for, and neither did anyone I know) makes me want to throw my whole phone out. Instagram is not a mall for me. It used to be a place for me to get exposure to all kinds of art, ideas, and people. I literally hate this stupid marketplace button so much.

ON TOP OF THIS, there's an account that's been using my photos to bait users into paying for porn. Every single person I've ever known has reported this account, and I've even sent a private email to Instagram begging them to take this account down. Nothing. It's goddamn embarrassing for a company with so much power behind it. If your information is compromised or your photos are being exploited for perverts to use to make money, DO NOT TRUST INSTAGRAM TO PROTECT YOU. They are protecting their profits, and clearly they're playing the short game because those profits ain't gonna last long when you lose your early adopters after so many years like this: not with a bang but with just an excruciatingly slow death.
title: Let's monetize until everyone leaves the app

review:
Does anyone else miss the glory days of Instagram?? Back in the 2016/2017 era before it became what it is now? The best algorithms. The old explore page. No shopping or shops tab. No reels or competing with or stealing from other apps. Back when Instagram was Instagram and that alone stood for something. Instagram used to be so good that it didn‚Äôt have to steal ideas from any other apps. 

Yep. Those were the days.

That‚Äôs why I award you...1 star. Literally went from a 4 or 5 star app right down to a 1 star. If you were a hotel you‚Äôd probably have bed bugs and make all the guests itchy.
title: The Glory Days of Instagram

review:
If I can be completely honest as a teenager who grew up on the internet this app will give you unrealistic expectations about everything, everything we see on there is staged, fake made to look pretty the only reason it gives us serotonin is because we can only hope to think we will have it someday to. Don't get your hopes up so high you‚Äôll only set yourself up for failure because the more we see other people having fun, enjoying their lives and then compare it to ours we are gonna fall into a sadness that will hurt us for so long but we keep going on this app for serotonin when in reality its only making us sad. ‚ÄùI come on social media constantly to try and fill in this void but it only makes it emptier‚Äù

review:
Look, the app is dope. One of the best platforms, I don‚Äôt really need to say much more.

But y‚Äôall really need to take action with some things. The bot issue is real and I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre working on it, but there needs to be a better way than just constantly reporting, because they‚Äôll always come back up.

Reporting is pretty rough too. I can understand having to use bots because I‚Äôm sure there are millions of reports, but it‚Äôs odd when I report straight up porn and I get a ‚Äúwe found nothing wrong‚Äù. It‚Äôs super rare you‚Äôll find something like that but when it comes around it‚Äôs just kinda odd that it can stay up.

Otherwise, good app. But bring back seeing the number of likes! Some businesses use it for competition and I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs another way to help prevent bullying online, like restricting likes for anybody under 19.

Many of us rely on Instagram as our main business platform. The algorithms that get accounts shut down, and lack of ability to contact anyone at Instagram regarding getting your account reinstated is extremely frustrating.

Why can‚Äôt I pay for help? 
Super frustrating.
